result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Leo Basile III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
06/29/2016:  Court reduces sentence from 18 months to 12 months.
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

No contact with N.B. without her and the agent's consent (effective 4:00 PM on 6-4-2015).
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, establishment/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
Defendant is not to be in a vehicle transporting alcohol or have alcohol in residence.
No physical violence.

Any counseling/treatment or programming per agent.
Sentence may be reduced to 12 months if agent agrees.

timeConds.notes:
may be served by 80 hours of community service.
Defendant chose community service hours.
